fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48146].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install *Confluence Questions Plugin 2.0.10*.
# Ask a *Question* using the following title:
#* 質問何ですか？
#* 中国语文
# Use the option "*Ask in a space...*".
!create.png|thumbnail!
# *Save* the question.
!cn-jp.png|thumbnail!
# Observe the result.

h3. Expected Behaviour
!expected.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Behaviour
!actual.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Append any characters behind the URL.
For example:
Original URL: http://www.example.com/confluence/display/QUES/questions/4063265/
Fixed URL 1: http://www.example.com/confluence/display/QUES/questions/4063265/- 
Fixed URL 2: http://www.example.com/confluence/display/QUES/questions/4063265/~
Fixed URL 3: http://www.example.com/confluence/display/QUES/questions/4063265/abc

h3. Note
[CQ-1707|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CQ-1707] bug ticket is about Question is not created at all due to Japanese language. As compared to the previous bug ticket raised, question is created successfully but the links are not pointing to the right direction.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48133].
  {panel}

Every now and then there is a mismatch between these two in Atlassian Answers.

!http://monosnap.com/image/VsUk09mk30Br1XOByMxMFhmd61vE2A.png!

h4.Workaround 

You can fix this by getting someone to up-vote/down-vote one of your questions or answers and this will trigger your reputation points to be re-calculated.
fields.summary: Mismatch between reputation graph and actual points
Do not show the 'ban this user' button if the user can't be banned

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48131].
  {panel}

After upgrading Confluence Questions to the latest version (1.0.618) available on the marketplace, the Questions button is gone from the header.

In the Universal Plugin Manager there is 35 modules enabled.

h3. Workaround
In the Universal Plugin Manager:
# Remove the license key, click Update.
# Put the license back, click Update. Doing that should force the plugin to reinitialise (Don't worry you won't loose any data)

fields.summary: Upvote link from email result in exception
Expert of the week reputation is wrong
Font size of question titles is too big
BSB has some search issues
Deleting topics is very painful
Second level nav is indented too far

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48102].
  {panel}

I've noticed that the Leaderboard on Answers isn't working correctly.
For Example: the Weekly Leaderboard for All topics shows Nic Brough at number 1 with 31405 point (I know he's really active but not that active :) )
Here is a screenshot:
!leadersboard-1.jpg!

Also using the topic filters doesn't change the leaderboard all that much, while I do remember from the old Answers Site that especially for Crucible the Leaderboard looked totally different.

Best regards,
Peter
fields.summary: Leaderboard on Atlassian Answers isn't working correctly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48095].
  {panel}

When presented with a CQ page which already has 100 individual responses, if a user attempts to add a new response, they are given no warnings or errors.

Upon arriving at the page after submitting the form, they are unable to find their answer on the page. (They can repeat this several times to no avail.)

This presents an obvious issue: Their answer cannot be read and/or considered at any point.

Potential solutions:

1. Remove the 100 cap!
2. Implement pagination.
3. Sort questions by score, low voted questions will naturally fall off the page. (This solution will only work whilst there are less than 100 questions with less than +1 vote.)

The page I was trying to add answers to was: https://extranet.atlassian.com/questions/2293501429/answers/2292192278#
fields.summary: Truncating and hiding answers after 100 answers have been provided.
please update CQ at translations.atlassian.com

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48090].
  {panel}

Atlassian Answers has reputation-based permissions enabled, which grants additional features to users based on how much reputation they've earned.  Additionally, we also have some customizations in place that reward users with Atlassian merchandise at certain reputation levels.

When users begin to accrue over 1,000 reputation points, Confluence Questions displays an abbreviated value in their user profile for points earned.  I assume this was done to save on horizontal space used and because digits become less significant as the magnitude of points accrued increases.  Confluence Questions will round up or down to the nearest significant digit to to this.

Unfortunately this can be very confusing as a user when you're working towards a specific point level.  We give away a T-Shirt on Answers at 1,500 points, but the profile will display "1.5K" before the user has actually reached 1,500 points.  

To avoid this confusion, the rounding algorithm should only ever round down. "1,499" points should display as "1.4k", not "1.5k".
fields.summary: Rounding up reputation scores makes people think that they have reached permission or reward levels prematurely

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

Steps to reproduce the error.

1) select a question with no answers.
2) answer the question.
3) Hit the back button to get back to the question list

The question I just answered still shows a zero answer count.
fields.summary: Hitting the back button from a question to question list does not show the answer count correctly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48088].
  {panel}

If I try to access answers.atlassian.com while logged in with my Atlassian ID I am redirected to this URL: https://id.atlassian.com/profile/linkAccount.action?application=acac&continue=https%3a%2f%2fanswers%2eatlassian%2ecom%2f

And get a generic error - "An error occurred while attempting to fulfil your request"

I wasn't getting any account linking notifications prior to the change to CQ, and I can log in to all other Atlassian sites I have tried without any issues. If I log out on another site and then attempt to access Answers I also don't have any issues until I log in.

This isn't urgent, but it's a bit annoying

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48084].
  {panel}

Not all of our users are allowed access to Confluence Questions. However, I have found that questions - and comments on those questions - are appearing in the 'recently updated' macro feed for users who are not authorised to see them.

This effects the following macros:
- Recently Updated.
- Content By Label.
- Search Results.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48072].
  {panel}

We created a bot user account to run the migration script to Confluence Questions.

Some content ended up being set with the author as this bot, instead of the actual author.

See [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/users?username=migrationbot9001]

This is probably because the user who really added that content didn't get migrated due to some other error (see [CQ-1329]).

Once we solve [CQ-1329] we should fix up this content so it's associated with the correct user.  This will require some way to edit the author metadata associated with the content - this requirement will be handled by [CQ-1281].

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48048].
  {panel}

I make this issue as blocker because compare to production version, it now even loss the error message dialog
*Steps to reproduce*
- Create a Confluence Question. You could add comment and answers in there too
- In view mode Drag and drop a file 

*In SDOG*
- Trigger uploading, after finish, it will show error message: "Cannot find PageID or Draft ID"
*In current OD37 https://od37.jira-dev.com/wiki *
- After the bar complete, it the dialog staty there for a long time, return 500 error in console ( Same with SDOG) and show error message "error responding" in UI 

*Side note*
This issue somehow affect greatly to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CQ-1638 to decide that if it is a blocker or not. If I test with User B try to drag and drop a question created by user A, it trigger the uploading process but fail at this step so we don't know should we treat CQ-1638 as a new issue or not

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48040].
  {panel}

I was researching previous answers to the jira/clearquest syncing question.   I found this answer and a the link on bob swift's answer is broken.  It is also displaying a paragraph closing tag.

The question I was looking at was
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/4795/sync-jira-with-clearquest

Look at Bob swift's answer and you should see ending paragraph tag.
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/1924/jira-clearquest-integration/1928</p<>>
This link does not work.

The link should have been
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/1924/jira-clearquest-integration

This might be related to the broken comment links but it was the paragraph ending tag being part of the link that I thought made this issue different.

Trying to view a question from a deleted user causes NPE and stacktrace.

2. ask question as user A

Steps to reproduce

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48027].

Hey Guys,

Here's a feedback from my side. The thing I don't like is the default order of questions by popularity. I haven't found a way to have the order changed as my default order. When I click on questions the old order is restored. So I have to click twice questions and recent in order to refresh the list of questions in my favorite order. 

Beside that it actually looks awesome.

Cheers,
Udo

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48019].
  {panel}

The permissions I have set exclude certain users from posting questions, however they are still able to go directly to the URL and raise a question AND they still see the "Didn't find what you were looking for? Ask a question" panel on search results page.

STR:
1) Set group permissions on Confluence Questions.
2) Log into a user who is NOT a member of this group.
3a) Go to [base url]/questions.
3b) Perform a search.

Expected Result:
The user is not allowed to view questions or raise a question.

Actual Result:
The user is shown questions and is able to raise questions.

Steps:

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48014]. {panel} Larger image files are now being stored for the user avatars as part of CONFDEV-26653. This breaks some of the Confluence Questions pages where the avatar is being displayed with 256x256 dimensions (the image file size) rather than as 48x48 icons as expected (see both attachments). By inspecting the image in the browser, the following is shown: {code} {code} Manually changing the {code}aui-avatar-big{code} class to {code}aui-avatar-large{code} (in compliance with [ADG|https://developer.atlassian.com/design/1.5/foundations/avatars/]) fixes the issue and the image appears with 48x48 dimensions as expected. It's unclear as to what the 'aui-avatar-big' class is being used for as no CSS seems to appear specifically for this. The temporary fix from confluence-core is to override the CSS for when these avatars are being displayed, but a more permanent fix is needed.
fields.summary: Avatar sizes not properly set to 48x48

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48006].
  {panel}

There is no apparent way to update an attachment that was previously uploaded and linked in an answer. 

Steps to reproduce:
# Author an answer in CQ and use the Link function to upload an attachment and link it to a word or phrase in the answer
# Save the answer in CQ
# Update the attachment locally
# Edit the answer in CQ
# Click the linked text and choose Edit
# Click browse to upload the new version of the attachment (after the upload, there are now two attachments showing in the UI and the newer one appears to be highlighted although there is no modification date or version information to distinguish the to attachments)
# Click Save for the Link
# Click Save for the edited answer
# Hover over the link--note that ?version=1 still shows in the URL
# Click on the link and note that the original version of the attachment is downloaded
fields.summary: Unable to update attachments in answers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48003].
  {panel}

I am trying to ask a new question in Confluence Questions. It is no longer allowing me to create the question because it says I have to add at least one topic. When I add topics - either new ones or from the popular list - it just deletes them again and tells me I can't create the question until I add a topic....
(i have just come back from 1 week holiday in which time no-one else has used the trial version of Confluence or Confluence Questions as far as I can tell. Before the holiday I was able to create questions :( ).
I note that the 'Choose some topics for your question' appears as if it were a topic in the field, with the 'x' present to delete it which is also odd. Screen shot attached.
The second screen shot is what I see after pressing 'Add question'
